very sadly, and often in a way that involves crying too easily: The moral ambivalence and savagery of the original are lachrymosely diluted. All her poems were of the lachrymosely sentimental kind.

He wrote lachrymosely that a thousand sabres should have been drawn to defend her honour. He is the lachrymosely joking chronicler of loss in contemporary Australian society.
